response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and line two 8-inch cake pans. Sift together 2 cups flour, 1¾ cups sugar, ¾ cup cocoa powder, 1½ tsp baking soda, 1½ tsp baking powder, and 1 tsp salt into a large bowl.",
  "step2": "Add 2 eggs, 1 cup milk, ½ cup vegetable oil, and 2 tsp vanilla to the dry ingredients. Mix on medium speed until just combined. Gradually pour in 1 cup boiling water, mixing until the batter is smooth and thin.",
  "step3": "Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for 10 minutes.",
  "step4": "Turn the cakes out onto a wire rack to cool completely. While cooling, prepare the frosting by beating 1 cup softened butter with 3½ cups powdered sugar, ½ cup cocoa, and ½ cup milk until fluffy.",
  "step5": "Once cakes are fully cooled, level the tops if needed. Place one layer on a serving plate and spread a thick layer of frosting on top. Carefully place the second layer on top.",
  "step6": "Frost the top and sides of the cake with the remaining chocolate frosting. Decorate with chocolate shavings or sprinkles if desired. Slice and serve your delicious chocolate cake to 8 happy guests!"
}
